entry.title: Moduli of $G$-constellations and crepant resolutions II: the Craw-Ishii conjecture
entry.summary: For any given finite subgroup $G\subset SL_3(\mathbb{C})$, we show that every projective crepant resolution $X$ of the quotient variety $\mathbb{C}^3/G$ is isomorphic to the moduli space of $\theta$-stable $G$-constellations for a generic stability condition $\theta$, as conjectured by Craw and Ishii. We also show that generators of the Cox ring of $X$ can be obtained from semi-invariants for representations of the McKay quiver of $G$. Moreover, we give an explicit description of the two symplectic resolutions of $\mathbb{C}^4/T$ constructed by Lehn and Sorger for a binary tetrahedral group $T\subset \mathrm{Sp}_4(\mathbb{C})$ as fine moduli spaces of $T$-constellations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 46 pages. v2: Expositions (especially in the proof of Lemma 4.3) improved, with other minor changes
